brewery.brewery_description:
With a lot of passion for craft beer this brewery was founded in 2011.

Since then, we try to design and improve our recipes in order to create artisanal Belgian craft beers. 

Try to get a hold of us and enjoy the taste of what a good craft beer should taste like.

Dare to taste, learn to enjoy!

This stout is the second beer of our D.O.M. black trilogy. Optimo is a gently smoked stout. We achieved this aroma by using peaty whisky malt instead of the usual smoke malts.

Have a taste and enjoy.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly whatâ€™s on tap! That's 85 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 18!

beer.beer_description: For the 200th brew in our own brewery we followed the same numbers as we did for our 100th brew.

items.badge_description: You don't always intend to go for beers with a double digit ABV, but when you do, you make it count! Cheers to you, but be careful, 10% and up can really pack a punch. That's 215 different beers with an ABV of 10% and up. Try 5 more for Level 44!

beer.beer_description:
Qantelaar is the first beer of brewery "dâ€™Oude Maalderij". 

We try to design and improve our recipes in order to create artisanal Belgian craft beers. The "Qantelaar" is created with 5 malts, a bit of candy sugar, 2 hops and ferments in the bottle. We use 30% more ingrediÃ«nts than a regular brown beer which gives it a great body and taste. We donâ€™t add any herb, spice or chemical compound in this traditional Belgian brown strong beer.

Try to get a hold of it and enjoy the taste of what a good craft beer should taste like.

Dare to taste, learn to enjoy!

items.badge_description: Whoa, your love of different beers is extraordinary! That's at least 1,000 distinct brews!

user.bio: A beer a day keeps the doctor away

Barley Wine Aged for 14 Months in Cognac Barrels. label art by Antonio Bravo and joins together with the label of Scylla.
Brewed with fresh capuchin herb. In the green forest of the D.O.M. landscape a true genuine plant was discovered and brought back to spice up the local craft Brews.

A winterbeer? Why not?

 

I'm not used to brew seasonal beers. I'd rather not classify any beer within a season. Any beer should be drunk when you feel like it. But I have to admit that a warm summerday calls for a lower abv, refreshing one, spring maybe for a saison, autumn might just settle with a bockbeer.

 

So why not clarify this beer as my first go on a seasonal one?

The obvious questionthat comes to mind is: "What makes a winterbeer a winterbeer?"  So I did what most brewers would probably do. Pick the back of your brain, check and verify the world wide web and call some brewfriends and discuss.

 

Eventually I came up with following aspects, allthough winterbeer is not concidered an actual beerstyle.

 

-high ABV

-brown or black color

-low IBU

-often spiced (most often with star anise and licorice)

 

Because I don't entirely like to do the expected, I chose a low abv brown ale. And instead of spicing it up with the usual, I decided to go with a Holland cookie spices mix. This might bring back the memories of what you would eat and smell in a cold december month while you were young.

 

But in the end it will be the low abv and medium body that makes this beer easier drinkable than most winterwarmers.

 

Have a go and see for yourself what comes to mind while savouring this new member of the homo beerectus family.

beer.beer_name: Homo Beerectus: Hop Hanker Sorachi Ace
beer.beer_description:
Here we are again, happy and proud to present yet another beer in our project. This time we chose for a summer style beer, in the hope we do get to enjoy some summerdays here. A low ABV, blond, hoppy, lagerish beer is on it's way to you!

 

As the first of 6 single (Belgian) hop beers, we chose Sorachi Ace as our primus.

 

On a nice Februari day, we found ourselves in the little town of Proven. It's in this pitoresk place that we met Benedikt and Wout on their hopfarm. Honestly I was quiet astonished how much effort and passion these people put in their product. The main reason why they keep noumerous "blauw wit" cows is because they need their dung to furtilise their hopfields.

 

For all I know it's the first commercial field of Sorachi Ace in Belgium. As a progressive brewery we like to help out and try newer things.

The recipe for this beer was already written with an opening for 6 different hop flavours. The goal is to point out the differences and the simularities between them in an easy drinkable beer (a bit like mikkel ordered to do). Offcourse we would only use premium Belgian hops.

 

So go ahead and enjoy this summery beer (With high hopes the Belgian weather allows us to).

 

p.s. For all those who oppose to the taste of Sorachi Ace: Just try and see that this Belgian variant is less bitter but very good in taste and flavour.
Barleywine aged for 22 months on Gouden Carolus single malt whisky barrels

beer.beer_name: Brewmance Mash of the Titans Verzet
beer.beer_description: BW at 19.3Â°P with rye and late hopping with 0.5kg Sorachi Ace per HL. Part of the unique and limited brewmance collaboration 6-pack.

beer.beer_name: Brewmance Mash of the Classics Lupulus
beer.beer_description:
Mash of the Classics, Lupulus edition.
Excessieve hopgiften in het kookproces, in de whirlpool en in de lagering zorgen dat deze IPA zijn aromatische smaak en geur combineert met zijn stevige bitterheid.
ItÂ´s in the dark swamps of the D.O.M. landscape youÂ´ll discover a magic so black that it will remind you of the smells and aromas you have been seeking for...

beer.beer_name: Brewmance Mash of the Titans Alvinne
beer.beer_description: BW at 21.5Â°P with malted oats and addition of fig leaves and palosantowood. Part of the unique and limited brewmance collaboration 6-pack.

"Back to basics" is what we thought to be

a good start for the 4th beer in this project.

 

Maybe for too long brewers and companies were looking

to go extreme in any direction in order to create extreme beers.

So as you may expect, we chose the unexpected

and went straight back a couple of decades

to brew our version of an all-time Belgian classic.

 

Eager Eagle is a true Belgian tripel.

Because of the relegation in general taste,

there are a lot of very simular tripels on todays market.

The taste and color are very simular

because the recipe are all very simular as well.

So where will we make the difference,

I see you wonder.

 

Well, we'll go further back in time and brew the same recipe

but without altering water, filtering and pasteurizing.

And without adding taste enhancers and foam stabilizers.

Only our regular tap water, 1 malt, 1 sugar, 1 yeast

and 2 hops are used in our Eagle.

 

When you taste this beer you'll see we still managed to create

a fine body and soul for this curious bird.

beer.beer_name: Brewmance Mash of the Classics Boon
beer.beer_description:
Mash of the Classics, Boon edition
Terwijl de familie Boon bekend staat voor hun geuzebieren maakten wij met dit brouwsel een Engelse stijl Porter met een knipoog naar lambiekbier door het gebruik van Belgische tarwe.
Belgian Barleywine aged in Westport whisky barrels. Label art by Antonio Bravo. forms one big painting when you add it to the label of Charybdis.

Collab between D.O.M. & food,fire,&fun.
Gently smoked 120kg of fresh butternut and a small quantity of pigments d'espelettes to bring this beer to the next level.
